SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.crypto

Interface Kzg

All Known Implementing Classes:
CKzg
public interface Kzg
Interface for KZG (Kate-Zaverucha-Goldberg) commitment operations.

KZG commitments are used in EIP-4844 blob transactions to enable data availability sampling. Implementations of this interface provide cryptographic operations for computing and verifying blob commitments.

Typical implementations will use a trusted setup ceremony output (e.g., from the Ethereum KZG ceremony) to initialize the cryptographic parameters.

Thread Safety

Implementations of this interface MUST be thread-safe. All methods may be called concurrently from multiple threads without external synchronization. Implementations should document any internal synchronization mechanisms or state management that ensures thread safety.
Since:
0.2.0

  • Method Details

    • blobToCommitment

      KzgCommitment blobToCommitment(Blob blob)
      Computes a KZG commitment for the given blob.

      The commitment is a 48-byte compressed G1 point on the BLS12-381 curve that uniquely represents the blob data.

      Parameters:
      blob - the blob to commit to
      Returns:
      the KZG commitment for the blob
      Throws:
      KzgException - if commitment computation fails
      NullPointerException - if blob is null

    • computeProof

      KzgProof computeProof(Blob blob, KzgCommitment commitment)
      Computes a KZG proof for the given blob and commitment.

      The proof enables verification that the blob corresponds to the given commitment without requiring the full blob data.

      Parameters:
      blob - the blob data
      commitment - the KZG commitment for the blob
      Returns:
      the KZG proof
      Throws:
      KzgException - if proof computation fails
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null

    • verifyBlobKzgProof

      boolean verifyBlobKzgProof(Blob blob, KzgCommitment commitment, KzgProof proof)
      Verifies that a KZG proof is valid for the given blob and commitment.

      This method checks that the proof correctly proves the blob data corresponds to the given commitment.

      Parameters:
      blob - the blob data
      commitment - the KZG commitment
      proof - the KZG proof to verify
      Returns:
      true if the proof is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      KzgException - if verification fails due to invalid inputs or internal error
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null

    • verifyBlobKzgProofBatch

      boolean verifyBlobKzgProofBatch(List<Blob> blobs, List<KzgCommitment> commitments, List<KzgProof> proofs)
      Verifies multiple blob-commitment-proof tuples in a batch.

      This method is more efficient than verifying each tuple individually when multiple blobs need to be verified.

      Parameters:
      blobs - the blob data
      commitments - the KZG commitments
      proofs - the KZG proofs
      Returns:
      true if all proofs are valid, false if any is invalid
      Throws:
      KzgException - if verification fails due to invalid inputs or internal error
      IllegalArgumentException - if the lists have different sizes
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
